de.fhb.sailboat.control.navigator

Class WorkerThread<T extends Task>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • de.fhb.sailboat.control.navigator.WorkerThread<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the Task, that a subclass executes
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeatWorker, ReachCircleWorker, ReachPolygonWorker

    public abstract class WorkerThread<T extends Task>
extends java.lang.Thread
    Base class for navigation threads. Subclasses are responsible for executing a specific Task in a concurrent way. This class provides general methods for navigation, that can be used in multiple subclasses.
    Author:
    hscheel

      • setTask

        public final void setTask(T task,
           GPS startPosition,
           GPS goal)
        Sets the task and triggers calculations for the new task. Additional, the position of the boat at the start of the task is set.
        Parameters:
        task - the new task to execute

      • taskHasChanged

        protected void taskHasChanged()
        Calculates everything necessary when the task to be executed has changed. This method is a hook for subclasses to add own calculations. Subclasses that need own calculations to be done when the task changed, should override this method and execute their calculations.

      • waitForNextCycle

        protected void waitForNextCycle()
        Waits for an defined time and interrupts thread if there was an interrupt during waiting.

      • calcAngleToGPS

        public double calcAngleToGPS(GPS goal)
        Calculates the absolute angle from the current position to the goal.
        Parameters:
        goal - the GPS to reach
        Returns:
        angle from the current position to goal

      • calcIdealLineDist

        public double calcIdealLineDist(GPS currentPos)
        Calculates the distance from the current position to the ideal line between a start and the goal position.
        A negative value means that the given currentPos is left from the ideal line, based on the direction of travel
        A positive value means that the given currentPos is right from the ideal line, based on the direction of travel
        The interpretation of the resulting distance is matter of the caller. e.g. A transformation into meters had to be done yet, if required. (Internal note: perhaps we can misuse that function to perform a cross line task too!)
        Parameters:
        start - Start position that defines the line
        goal - Destination position that defines the line
        currentPos - Current position for which the distance to that line shall be calculated
        Returns:
        The distance of the given currentPos to the imaginary line between start and goal

      • calcIdealLineAngle

        public double calcIdealLineAngle(GPS currentPos)
        Calculates the angle from the current position to the line between a start position to the goal.
        Parameters:
        currentPos - the current position of the boat
        Returns:
        the angle to reach the line

      • isBeatNecessary

        public boolean isBeatNecessary(double desiredAngle)
        Checks if the boat can reach the desired angle considering the current wind.
        Parameters:
        desiredAngle - the angle to the goal
        Returns:
        if the angle can be reached
